entry.title: Unleash your procurement transformation potential with SAP Signavio for SAP Ariba - Part III
entry.content:
Part III: Customer story - Improve supplier payment

This blog post is part of the blog series “Unleash your procurement transformation potential with SAP Signavio for SAP Ariba”. To get an overview of the SAP Signavio capabilities for analyzing processes across SAP ERP and SAP Ariba, check out the first blog post from @dianakveit7.

To make these capabilities more tangible for you, we started to examine a concrete customer example in our second blog post from my colleague @Katharina_Minninger. After analyzing and improving the process from purchase requisition to supplier invoice, we'll now continue with the invoice-to-pay process as a second improvement area.

Process House

Identify issues in the invoicing process

Let’s jump to the invoicing process analysis and check what the process looks like based on the data. We'll deep dive into our variant analysis to do this.

You can see on the right that there are 13 variants, and you can choose which variants you’d like to investigate, and investigate which steps are included. For example, you can identify how the invoices are handled from different channels, such as SAP Ariba, SAP SRM, or the BAPI interface.

Process Variants

Even in the variant most used, we can clearly see that it takes more than 8 weeks for the payment to be made.

If we switch to the hot spot mode of our process variant, we can see to what extent the activities are executed in our end-to-end process. The green and red boxes show what's recommended based on leading SAP practices. This is also a basis for our best-run score calculation.

Process Variants: Hotspots

The green bubble on the red box indicates that a quarter of your invoices are in processes involving a dialog user in a manual and time-consuming fashion, even using non-standard transactions.

We want our process to be efficient and to automate as many activities as possible. But what can we do with this situation? Where do we start? Let’s check the value potential of the possible improvements.

Prioritize by potential value savings and industry benchmark

Let’s jump to the value analysis feature in SAP Signavio Process Insights.

Value Analysis

Based on specific input values that you can add, you can see your potential value. We can see that this is more than 10 million behind the supplier invoice clearing that you can aim for if you step up when it comes to increasing your automation rate.

Industry benchmarks greatly support you in putting your automation rate into perspective. You can see that your industry median is 81% and that, with 54%, your organization is in the lowest quartile.

Based on the benchmark and the value behind it, this is clearly something to investigate.

“Drink your own champagne” – use best practices from your internal best-run entities

Considering the value, it would be interesting to know how this looks across your organization. You can use internal benchmarking to identify your best-running entities.

Internal benchmarking

We can see that there's one company code that runs best. All metrics are marked in green across invoice creation, payment, and early and late payments. Other company codes, marked in red, show a high improvement potential.

Next, let’s deep dive into concrete process variants to understand how well harmonized we execute our flows.

Let’s take our benchmark company code (2700) and compare it with the one we see as a potential priority for improvement (company code 2800).

Process variants comparison

From the comparison, we can clearly see some potential for company code 2800 and check on best practices that we could potentially reuse from our benchmark company.

If you also look at the company code analysis, you might already notice that there’s an improvement potential for late payments.

Analyze your payment behavior

To make sure we get our materials on time and minimize any risk of damaging the relationship with our main suppliers, or even worse, having to pay penalty interest, let’s switch to our analysis ‘Improve on-time payment performance’ in SAP Signavio Process Intelligence.

Payment behavior overview

By looking at the overall situation, we can conclude that we need to have a closer look at the payment behavior.

Late payments

You pay on average 11 days later than what's agreed in the payment terms. This affects more than a third of your invoices, which account for almost 3B USD. The impact of this – so your potential to quickly change – is more than 1.6M USD.

But why are invoices being paid so late? You can determine this by using the out-of-the-box root cause analysis.

Top root causes for late payments

We see that most of the value is paid late due to a high volume of manual activities. We also see that a third of all late invoices are posted or payment blocks are released after the net due date.

What does this mean? Let’s see what the detailed root causes tell us.

Deep dive into root causes of inefficient payments

RCA deep dive

We see that approval is made after the net due date, which means that there might be an issue with three-way matching. The invoice verification team needs to check the deviations with involved parties and approve them first.

The fact that invoices are being posted after the net due date means that we might need to check the blocking reasons that cause your invoices to be blocked for payment. While there might be valid reasons to block invoices, these blocks negatively impact supplier satisfaction. This seems to be a fundamental problem that needs more long-term adjustments.

If you would like to learn more about how to improve your invoice-to-pay process using the plug and gain approach, check out the following blog post: How to improve your invoice-to-pay process using plug and gain by SAP Signavio.

Get long-term process improvement strategies recommended by SAP

Having pinpointed the primary reasons for late payments, you may be interested in suggestions on how to enhance your processes in the long term. The innovation recommendations in SAP Signavio Process Insights list potentially unutilized SAP solution features and advancements.

Innovation recommendations

For instance, to optimize the source-to-pay process, SAP Signavio Process Insights recommends the SAP Business Network for fully automated and vetted supplier collaboration from purchase requisition until invoicing.

How to get it?

In case you think the demonstrated analyses in our blog series would provide value to you and your organization, you might ask yourself how you can get those. These analyses are part of the plug and gain by SAP Signavio approach. It leverages the capabilities of the SAP Signavio Suite and provides unique out-of-the-box analyses for both continuous improvement and transformation projects sparing you long implementation projects.

Reach out to your SAP counterpart to learn more about how you could benefit from plug and gain by SAP Signavio!

Where to find further information

  • The following note explains the prerequisites and scope of plug and gain by SAP Signavio: https://me.sap.com/notes/3340986/E
  • Blogs on Best-Run scores, process house, transaction scores and process flow variants
  • Plug and gain approach: https://www.signavio.com/plug-and-gain-approach/

entry.title: Unleash your procurement transformation potential with SAP Signavio for SAP Ariba - Part II
entry.content:
Part II: Customer story

This blog post is part of the blog series “Unleash your procurement transformation potential with SAP Signavio for SAP Ariba”. To get an overview of the SAP Signavio capabilities for analyzing processes across SAP ERP and SAP Ariba, check out the first blog post by @dianakveit7. To make these capabilities more tangible for you, we'll now look at a concrete customer example.

Business processes have become increasingly complex and frequently lack transparency within an intricate IT landscape. They're often fragmented and full of hidden inefficiencies. This results in uncertainty about the relevance of process transformation efforts, which is compounded by the high costs associated with these projects.

Imagine this:

  • You have a holistic, comprehensive view of your entire source-to-pay process running across multiple systems.
  • You can pinpoint the most impactful improvements easily with an intelligent, value-driven approach.
  • You can unlock untapped value in a way not previously possible.
  • And the best part: You don't need months and years to do it – you can start right away!

This is exactly what the new value accelerator for analysis of source-to-pay (plug and gain approach) offers. It provides an out-of-the-box analysis across SAP ERP and SAP Ariba, enabling you to gain transparency and realize untapped value within a few short hours.

We've created several deep dive analyses that are easily available for customers to use in their ongoing enhancement efforts and transformation projects. Each deep dive aims to give you insights into a specific business scenario and includes value identification and SAP recommendations as basic characteristics.

The data used originates from SAP Signavio Process Insights, which is standard in the plug and gain approach. This means that the dashboards provide data quickly without a need to create or use special extractors in SAP Signavio Process Intelligence. You get insights out-of-the-box. The data spans multiple process flows, standard performance indicators, and master data from both SAP Ariba and SAP ERP systems. This means that you can see your whole source-to-pay process. You can also view the data over long time periods, which helps you to identify patterns and trends.

Value accelerator for analysis of source-to-pay (plug and gain approach): Data

The dashboards are designed to conveniently guide users through the analysis. You'll get explanations about the context and underlying motivation, as well as possible conclusions and recommendations for each analysis. You also get information about what to do next and how to resolve root causes. This makes it easy for all business users to use the analysis without extensive technical knowledge of SAP ERP or process mining.

Start with the full picture

An overview of the end-to-end processes used in your organization provides the ideal starting point for analysis. As part of the plug and gain approach, you get access to your organization's own process house, packed with best-run scores for each of your end-to-end processes. The process house is a central point for you and allows you to understand performance in terms of efficiency and end-to-end process usage throughout the organization. The best-run score is an aggregated score over all sub-processes currently available for your organization. To learn more about the best-run score and process house, check out the following blog posts: Best-Run scores, process house.

Process House: Overview

Thanks to the traffic lights, it's easy to identify if there's improvement potential in the source-to-pay and financial area. We can even already estimate the potential impact, because these processes are used frequently according to the case count provided. Let’s take a closer look and deep dive into the source-to-pay modular processes.

Identify focus areas

Process House: Level 2

Based on the best-run score for the specific process variants, you can see which variants need our attention most:

  • Purchase requisition item to invoice receipt
  • Supplier payment with purchase order

We can also see that these processes have a significant number of completed cases. Let’s jump into SAP Signavio Process Intelligence to analyze the processes in detail. We'll start with the process from purchase requisition item to invoice receipt...

Dive deep into the process

Funnel diagram: Source-to-pay process across systems

In the process execution widget, you get full transparency into your source-to-pay process across SAP ERP and SAP Ariba. In the upper lane, you see all the events that took place in your SAP ERP system. In the lower lane, you see all the events in your SAP Ariba system – and that’s transparency at its best! You don't need to make any assumptions – you really see the process from a fact-based perspective.

The funnel diagram tells us many things about the current situation and integration scenarios of SAP Ariba:

  • The procurement process runs across SAP ERP and SAP Ariba applications.
  • Most purchase requisitions and purchase orders are created and processed in SAP Ariba, but there are still some steps that are completed only in the SAP ERP system. If you have a policy that all purchase orders should be processed using SAP Ariba, this indicator already helps you to define where training is missing, or where some procedures need to be updated.
  • There are purchases initiated without a preceding purchase requisition.
  • It looks like SAP Ariba invoicing capabilities aren't fully adopted.

Best-Run Score and Automation rate

The metrics below indicate significant improvement potential for several steps of the process. For instance, we can see that a purchase order is manually created in more than 60% of cases. Also, the best-run score is quite low, indicating that purchase orders aren't being created in line with leading practices.

Analyze manual processing

To dive deeper into the topic of manual processing, let's take a closer look at the corresponding operational efficiency dashboard:

Dashboard: Improve operational efficiency

Looking at the main metrics, we see that there's a significant number of purchase requisitions and purchase orders that are being processed manually. These documents are created manually and later changed.

The high number of manual changes to business objects for both purchase requisitions and purchase orders means that the purchaser must adjust the documents several times before ordering, which increases manual effort. And this is worse again if the changes are made after the invoice for the order has already been posted.

The value of actively improving the automation rate is now clear. More than 10M USD of costs are associated with manual processing alone in the analyzed period of one year. The next question is, what we can do to improve this situation?

Start improving right away

Correction Recommendations

To enable you to start improving right away, SAP Signavio Process Insights offers correction recommendations, which provide specific quick fixes with a relevant impact.

Improve purchase order item creation

In our example, we want to start by improving purchase order creation to avoid manual changes. To enhance the process to create purchase orders, SAP recommends training users to use the catalog instead of free text. The following action items are recommended:

  • Check if product catalogs are available for the items that were created with free text.
  • Based on the results, either users can be trained to use existing catalog items, or the catalog coverage can be increased.

This is how you can start improving straight away. The first action item has already been identified!

Let's now take a closer look at our invoicing process, because this was the second focus area identified earlier. We'll continue our analysis in Part III of our blog series, shared by my colleague @nklimenko…

entry.title: Future proofing your business with procurement technology
entry.content:
Watch our intro video before you start 

What’s Your Procurement Strategy Persona?

Please record your answers offline to define your persona

1. When it comes to choosing suppliers, your priority is:

  • A) Price and cost savings.
  • B) Quality and reliability.
  • C) Innovation and technology.
  • D) Long-term relationships and collaboration.

2. How do you typically handle contract compliance?

  • A) We focus on price terms and conditions.
  • B) We have a robust monitoring system in place.
  • C) We leverage technology for real-time tracking.
  • D) We emphasize mutual trust and flexibility.

3. What is your approach to managing procurement categories?

  • A) Grouping similar products for bulk purchasing.
  • B) Detailed analysis and specialized management for each category.
  • C) Using advanced software for dynamic category management.
  • D) Collaborative planning with suppliers.

4. In terms of supplier risk management, you:

  • A) Regularly review financial stability and performance.
  • B) Focus on diversifying your supplier base.
  • C) Use predictive analytics to foresee potential risks.
  • D) Build strong, long-term relationships to mitigate risks.

5. What’s your stance on payment terms with suppliers?

  • A) Negotiating the best possible payment terms to improve cash flow.
  • B) Ensuring fair and timely payments to maintain good relationships.
  • C) Utilizing technology to manage and optimize payment schedules.
  • D) Customizing payment terms based on individual supplier agreements.

6. How do you see the role of AI in procurement?

  • A) AI can help reduce costs and find the best deals.
  • B) AI can improve the accuracy and efficiency of procurement processes.
  • C) AI is crucial for gaining strategic insights and recommendations.
  • D) AI can enhance collaboration and decision-making with suppliers.

7. When planning for the future, your main concern is:

  • A) Keeping costs low and maintaining budget control.
  • B) Ensuring the highest quality of goods and services.
  • C) Staying ahead of the competition with cutting-edge technology.
  • D) Building a resilient and adaptable supply chain.

8. What’s your approach to dealing with supply chain disruptions?

  • A) Having a backup plan and alternative suppliers ready.
  • B) Focusing on supplier reliability and performance.
  • C) Utilizing advanced analytics to predict and respond to disruptions.
  • D) Collaborating closely with suppliers to develop contingency plans.

9. How important is it for you to integrate technology in your procurement process?

  • A) It’s important for cost tracking and savings.
  • B) It’s essential for maintaining high standards and efficiency.
  • C) It’s critical for staying innovative and competitive.
  • D) It’s valuable for improving supplier relationships and collaboration.

10. What’s your biggest procurement challenge right now?

  • A) Managing and reducing costs.
  • B) Ensuring contract compliance and quality.
  • C) Keeping up with technological advancements.
  • D) Building and maintaining strong supplier relationships.

Please review your corresponding personality type:

  • Mostly As: Cost Controller 
  • Mostly Bs: Quality Guardian 
  • Mostly Cs: Tech Innovator 
  • Mostly Ds: Relationship Builder 

If you have the same number of answers in two or more personality types, please review all of the videos related to your personalities.

Now you're a step closer towards transforming your procurement organization.

entry.title: Where can I start learning processes managed by the SAP Ariba Contracts solution?
entry.content:
I recommend to access our Discovering SAP Ariba Contracts learning journey.

Overview
This learning journey will introduce you to the key features and benefits of SAP Ariba Contracts.

Learning objectives
After completing this course, administrators, architects, business users, and consultants will be able to summarize the features and benefits of and the processes managed by the SAP Ariba Contracts solution.

Pass all the quizzes and receive a digital badge.
Please ask a question related to the digital learning Journey in the Q&A area.

Our SAP Learning Experts will get back to you as soon as possible! We are here to support you. 

I appreciate your feedback and we will make sure to continue sharing interesting topics.

Kind regards
Margit

entry.title: Real-Time Support for Procurement Webcast: Introduction to the SAP Community!
entry.content:
Real-Time Support for Procurement Webcast Series

SAP Support's Digital Strategy team successfully hosted a live webcast on Aug 22, 2024. During this live session, we covered:

  • Why and how you should use the SAP Community
  • How to get registered
  • Asking questions to find help
  • Finding and following relevant tags 
  • Commenting & Answering 
  • Blogs on the SAP Community
  • Gamification, direct messages, and settings 
  • Where to find resources to become an SAP Community super-user! 

Watch or rewatch the webcast here (17:45, English)!

Download the slides

Get registered today!

 

What is the SAP Community and why should you register?

SAP Community Tour

Benefits to joining with absolutely no cost:

  • Connect and engage with like-minded professionals
  • Ask questions and share your product knowledge
  • Participate in discussions with SAP experts
  • Follow topics that align with your interests and/or location
  • Learn and stay current on SAP products through blogs
  • Explore and join groups, events, and fun contests

As a user of SAP Ariba, SAP Business Network, and/or SAP Fieldglass products, check out the Spend Management content page. Here, you can Search, look through the different boards for Q&A or Blogs, see recent feed, find learning material, and more. 

 

Why use the SAP Community for Procurement products?

There are a lot of different Support options and tools available to you, no matter how you use SAP products. Find how-to information, FAQs, Documentation, tutorials, and guided help in our Help Centers for Ariba Suppliers/ Buyers or Fieldglass users. 

Getting Support from SAP is easy and useful, but there are times when you want advice or guidance from fellow users. Maybe your site configuration is unique and you want to see how other companies handle a certain site setting, or you are looking for best practices about enabling a new feature, or you're an integrated customer looking for help on multiple SAP solutions. 

The SAP Community is completely free to use and offers you a vast network of users and experts! 

 

Your turn!

Subscribe to tags to customize your experience. 

Click on one of the tags from this blog directly to start following content, or Subscribe manually: 

  1. Visit the SAP Community.
  2. Click Products and Technology > All SAP Managed Tags.
  3. Find and click on a tag you're interested in.
  4. Click Subscribe. 

Look for all our tags starting with SAP Ariba, SAP Business Network, and SAP Fieldglass! 

Ask questions for help, get advice on best practices, and consult with other SAP users and experts. 

A well-written question includes:

  • Clear & descriptive title
  • Steps taken that led to your question
  • Screenshots & specific error messages 
  • Specific details (product version, customizations, roles or user authorizations, etc)
  • Correct SAP managed tag(s) added
  • No personally identifiable information (vendor details, user contact information, account numbers, etc)

Share your product knowledge and showcase your expertise by answering questions and commenting. 

Follow the SAP Community Rules of Engagement whenever you are participating.

See all our how-to videos

Hope to see you engaging in the Spend Management area of SAP Community soon! 

Resources from the webcast: 

  • Access the on-demand presentation
  • SAP Community tour
  • How-to Community video tutorials
  • Rules of Engagement

 

Real-Time Support for Procurement Webcast Series

Check out our webcast calendar for upcoming presentations!
Did you miss a webcast? Review our archive for all past content!

entry.title: SAP Customers Conversations Event: SAP Ariba @ Nederlandse Gasunie on October 22 at 3 PM
entry.content:
Dear Utilities Community Members, 

We are pleased to invite you to our upcoming SAP Customer Conversations LIVE Event featuring Nederlandse Gasunie and their SAP Ariba project.

Gasunie manages and maintains the infrastructure for large-scale transport and storage of gas in the Netherlands and the northern part of Germany. 

Happy to have Erik Grave, Processmanager Requisition to Pay at Nederlandse Gasunie N.V., who will provide valuable insights into the project scope, lessons learned, and the impact of the new system on Gasunie's procurement processes.

The webcast will take place on Tuesday, October 22, 2024, from 3:00 - 4:00 PM CET! To register for the webcast, simply click on the following link: SAP Customers Conversations Event: SAP Ariba @ Nederlandse Gasunie (on24.com)

Don't miss this opportunity to gain insights from Gasunie's SAP Ariba project and learn how it could benefit your own organization. 

We look forward to having you join us for this insightful event.

entry.title: SAP Ariba Shopping App or SAP Ariba Procurement App? What fits best for me?
entry.content:
Hello Ariba Community,

This blog post aims to offer a comprehensive comparison of the functionality and product support provided by the SAP Ariba Shopping app and the SAP Ariba Procurement app, assisting you in determining which app is best suited for your specific procurement needs.

In essence, the SAP Ariba Shopping app, developed on the SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP), is a mobile native application that empowers employees and managers to navigate and shop from company catalogs. It is worth noting that the forthcoming 2411 update will introduce support for Level 1 punchout catalogs.

The shopping experience is comparable with shopping apps for consumers, therefore only minimal training is required to use the app. As shopping should be simple and fun you have certain restrictions on catalog item types and the ability of changing the purchase requisition. For those use cases, we recommend using the SAP Ariba Procurement app which is designed for procurement professionals and employees with advanced shopping needs such as ordering configurable items or doing an account split on item level.

Good news is that you can use both apps in parallel either for one user or for different user groups.

Let's first delve into the commercial conditions. The table below illustrates the Ariba products supported by each app:

 

Product                             

SAP Ariba Shopping

SAP Ariba Procurement

SAP Ariba Buying

supported

supported

SAP Ariba Buying and Invoicing

supported

supported

SAP Ariba SNAP

 

supported

SAP Ariba Sourcing

 

supported

SAP Ariba Contracts

 

supported

SAP Ariba Supplier Lifecycle and Performance Management

 

supported

If your organization has subscribed any of the listed products, you are entitled to use the app without incurring any additional license costs. However, it is important to be aware of any potential limitations in how the apps are utilizing the supported Ariba products:

 

Product / Product Scope

SAP Ariba Shopping

SAP Ariba Procurement

SAP Ariba Buying

Support for company catalogs

Support for company catalogs

SAP Ariba Buying and Invoicing

Support for company catalogs

Support for company catalogs

SAP Ariba SNAP

 

Support for company catalogs

SAP Ariba Buying with guided buying capability

Support for company catalogs and planned for 2411 punchout L1

Not supported:

  • Intelligent product recommendations
  • Policies
  • Favorites
  • Guided Buying tiles

Support for company catalogs.

Not supported:

  • Intelligent product recommendations
  • Policies
  • Favorites
  • Guided Buying tiles

Integration of guided buying with S/4 HANA or S/4 HANA Cloud (2NV/3EN scenario)

Both apps do not support requisitions when guided buying is integrated with SAP S/4HANA or SAP S/4HANA Cloud (2NV/3EN)

Both apps do not support requisitions created when guided buying is integrated with SAP S/4HANA or SAP S/4HANA Cloud  (2NV/3EN)

SAP Ariba Sourcing

 

Task management is supported

SAP Ariba Contracts

 

Task management is supported

SAP Ariba Supplier Lifecycle and Performance Management

 

Support for:

  • New supplier creation
  • Supplier request tracking

 

Here is the functionality comparison of shopping for both apps:

 

Shopping Functionality

SAP Ariba Shopping

SAP Ariba Procurement

Shopping goods from company catalogs

supported

supported

Shopping goods from L1 punchout catalogs

support planned for 2411 Ariba release

 

Non catalog request

supported

supported

Mandatory items

supported

supported

Track & trace purchase requisition approvals

supported

supported

Support of BME catalog items

 

supported

Configurable items (parametric/partial items)

 

supported

Edit item price

 

supported

Buy again

 

supported

Add account distributions

 

supported

Shop on behalf of another user

 

supported

Post Goods Receipt

 

supported

Change Purchase order

 

supported

 

Lastly, let's explore the roadmap for both applications. We are currently revising our roadmaps but one direction we can share is that we are thriving to enable Joule integration into our mobile app portfolio. As soon as we have clarity, I will share the roadmap items in a new blog post.

Enjoy shopping!

 

Michael Spiess

SAP Ariba Product Management

 

Further References:

  • New blog post about the latest release V1.12.0
  • Download (iOS/Android) SAP Ariba Shopping app 
  • Watch SAP Ariba Shopping App on Youtube
  • SAP Ariba Shopping roadmap for iOS and Android
  • SAP Ariba Procurement roadmap for iOS and Android
  • Blog post: Getting started with SAP Ariba Shopping App in 7 steps
  • SAP help: Getting started with SAP Ariba Procurement app

entry.title: 2411 Early Release Series for SAP Ariba and SAP Business Network releases
entry.content:
Sign up now for the 2411 Early Release Series

SAP strives to equip our customers and partners with valuable release readiness resources for each SAP Ariba and SAP Business Network quarterly release.

Follow this blog to receive notification of new series as soon as registration opens.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Early Release Series
The SAP Ariba and SAP Business Network Early Release series of webcasts cover features planned for the upcoming quarterly release.  This platform, available to customers and partners, has a clear mission: deliver an interactive forum to engage with SAP product experts providing simple, direct answers to your most pressing questions.  There is a different session for each product area with content tailored for the specific audience:

  • Supplier Management & Risk
  • Procure-to-Pay
  • Source-to-Contract
  • Business Network

If you want to learn more and actively engage with SAP subject matter experts, we encourage you to participate in these informative sessions.  Register now!

Quarterly Release Communications
Notice of upcoming quarterly releases will be communicated to Buyer customers three weeks prior to the release date.  Suppliers receive notice two weeks prior.  Releases are communicated via email notification (look for subject line starting with: Advance Release Notice).

Designated Support Contacts (DSC) and anyone from your organization that has chosen to subscribe to product notifications will receive these announcements. 

The release calendar for SAP Business Network  and release calendar SAP Ariba Applications identify release timing several quarters in advance.

Where to find out more details?
On demand replays of webcasts from completed quarterly releases can be consumed from Release Readiness Resources: Webcast Archive Page

entry.title: SAP Ariba Source to Contract 2411 Release Key Innovations Preview
entry.content:
Hello SAP Ariba Source to Contract Community and welcome to our 2411 key innovations blog.

We're excited to announce some great enhancements to our SAP Ariba Source-to-Contract solutions portfolio in Q4 2024. These new features are designed to streamline your procurement processes, boost efficiency, and deliver even more business value. Let’s dive into the details.

 

SAP Spend Control Tower

All businesses generate spend data. But capturing, rationalizing, and deriving insights from that data – especially when it is scattered across multiple systems, in different formats, and of questionable accuracy – is why we announced the development of SAP Spend Control Tower, our command center for enterprise-wide spend analysis, last year.

SAP Spend Control Tower can enable business leaders to answer questions, like where and how much did my organization spend? With what suppliers? Can we break that down by normalized categories? Where are my cost-savings opportunities? What about compliance with environmental and social regulations?

For more information please have a look at our product website.

 

SAP Ariba Category Management

Enhancements to Generative Artificial Intelligence (AI)

This quarter, we are pleased to introduce significant enhancements to our Generative AI capabilities. With these improvements, you can now generate articles in the Additional Resources section for tools like Category Segmentation, Market Dynamics, and Cost Structure on demand—no more default content generation. This selective approach not only enhances performance but also helps you reduce costs associated with producing AI-generated content.

 

 

Configure and Associate Business Units

As a category management administrator, you can now enjoy greater flexibility with our new feature that allows you to create and manage a two-level hierarchy for business units. Edit, inactivate, or delete these units as needed. Additionally, as a category manager, you can associate these business units with strategy and plan documents and various tools within the toolkit.

 

Create Category Strategy Details from the Develop Strategy and Plan App

The new Category Strategy Details capability in the Develop Strategy and Plan app is a key. This tool empowers category managers to create and manage multiple category-specific strategy details that align perfectly with the overall business strategy. Each strategy detail can be linked to one or more goals and business requirements, streamlining your documentation process and facilitating smooth approvals.

 

 

View, Analyze, and Manage Initiatives Across Categories

We introduce the new Initiatives Overview app, which offers functionalities for managing your initiatives efficiently across multiple category strategies. This provides procurement directors and CPOs with a great tool to draw their attention to the initiatives running behind plan. View your initiatives data through customizable tables and charts, filter and sort data, group rows, and add columns based on your needs. Export this data to a spreadsheet and gain visual insights with generated charts. Personalize your views and keep track of timelines to optimize initiatives effectively in your organization.

 

 

 

SAP Ariba Guided Sourcing

Create Optimization Scenarios for Multi-Round Bidding Events in Guided Sourcing

Our latest update in Guided Sourcing allows buyer users to create optimization scenarios for multi-round bidding events. This feature lets you edit constraints and update scenarios created in previous rounds with the latest data, ensuring more informed decision-making.

 

View Custom Categories of Supplier Risk in Guided Sourcing

Great news for those focusing on supplier risk. You can now view custom categories of supplier risk in guided sourcing events, available in Draft, Monitor, and Review responses states. This added flexibility helps in better risk management during sourcing events.

 

Dynamic Bid Adjustment Percentages in Guided Sourcing Auctions

We’ve introduced dynamic bid adjustment percentages for various auction types, including English forward, English reverse, Dutch, Japanese forward, and Japanese reverse auctions in guided sourcing. This feature allows for more competitive and adaptive bidding processes.

 

Enhancements to Grading and Scoring in Guided Sourcing

We've made some valuable enhancements to grading and scoring in guided sourcing:

- Section level grading is now rolled up for alternate bids on the Consensus grading page and Grade as a team member page.

- Graders can submit grades through the offline grade sheet only for primary bids.

- Sections cannot be graded unless the items in them have been bid.

 

Support for Overriding Terms After Bidding Ends in Guided Sourcing

After the bidding ends, event or project owners, or sourcing bid term editors now have the ability to enter or modify values for a term. Download all editable terms in a Microsoft Excel spreadsheet, make your modifications, and submit new term values for the event. Supplier bids will be recalculated based on these new term attributes.

 

SAP Ariba Contract Management

Importing and Exporting Service Line Items and Pricing Conditions Using Excel

We've enhanced the Simplified Excel Import functionality in SAP Ariba Contracts. Now, buyers can effortlessly import and export service line item data and pricing conditions in contract workspaces using an Excel file, making data management more straightforward and efficient.

 

Decommissioning of Next Gen UI for CLID

Please note that the Next Gen UI for Contract Line Items Documents (CLID) in SAP Ariba Contracts will be decommissioned. Customers will transition to the classic user interface, available by default, to manage CLIDs.

 

We are continually working to enhance SAP Ariba solutions to ensure you achieve the best results for your business. We hope these new features and enhancements help you streamline your procurement processes, making them more efficient and effective. Stay tuned for more updates and happy sourcing.

 

We invite you to explore these features in more detail in our SAP Ariba 2411 Release Key Innovations Preview session. Also, stay tuned for our additional upcoming blog posts and follow me to stay informed on upcoming feature releases across SAP Ariba.

Thank you for being a part of the SAP Ariba community and we look forward to continuing our journey of innovation together!

Resources:

    • Readiness Community page (For CIM customers)

  • SAP Help Portal pages - Procurement and Network

    • "Spend Management and Business Network" playlist - https://youtube.com/playlist?list=PLWV533hWWvDk7zRbhOsWQkF5BGWokhHYH&si=zTlYobcledkWNQ2M

entry.title: SAP Ariba 2411 Release Key Innovations Preview
entry.content:
Hello SAP Ariba community!

We're thrilled to announce some fantastic new features and enhancements for Q4 2024 across various SAP Ariba modules. These updates are designed to streamline your procurement processes, enhance supplier management, and provide deeper insights into supplier relationships. Let's take a high-level look at the most impactful innovations in this release.

For those of you wanting to explore specific functionalities in detail, we have provided links to dedicated blogs that dive deeper into each area. Let's take a look!

SAP Spend Control Tower

We're excited to share the latest development with you SAP Spend Control Tower. This new tool is designed to merge all your payment and supplier data into a single source of truth, enriched with AI-enabled spend classification and supplier insights. With intuitive dashboards and advanced machine learning models, it’s easier than ever to streamline our processes, cut procurement costs, manage supplier risks, and keep an eye on our diversity and sustainability goals.

Having a unified data source might just be the key to overcoming some of our biggest challenges. SAP Spend Control Tower takes the powerful analytics and reporting capabilities of the old SAP Ariba Spend Analysis solution and pushes them even further. If you're curious to learn more about how it could help us transform our spend management, I'd recommend checking out the full details on our SAP Spend Control Tower product page.

Spend overview dashboard in SAP Spend Control Tower

SAP Ariba Supplier Lifecycle and Performance and Supplier Risk

Intelligent Recommendations Based on Supplier Risk Score

SAP Ariba Supplier Risk now offers intelligent recommendations for suppliers experiencing significant changes in risk scores. These new insights help buyers proactively identify and mitigate potential risks.

New recommendations section in the SAP Ariba Supplier Risk dashboard

SAP Business Network Certificate Information in the Supplier Profile Summary

The supplier profile summary now features added visibility into certificates maintained in SAP Business Network profiles. The new “Business Network Certificates” panel provides additional data points for supplier assessments, offering a comprehensive view directly from their SAP Business Network profile.

Business network certificates in the supplier profile summary

See the SAP Ariba Supplier Lifecycle and Performance & Supplier Risk 2411 Release: Key Feature Highlights blog for more information on these and other supplier management features

SAP Ariba Source to Contract

Enhancements to Generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) in SAP Ariba Category Management

We're excited to introduce enhancements to our Generative AI capabilities in SAP Ariba Category Management. You can now selectively generate articles for tools like Category Segmentation, Market Dynamics, and Cost Structure on demand, improving performance and reducing costs associated with producing AI-generated content.

Enhancements to Generative Artificial Intelligence in SAP Ariba Category Management

Ability to Create Category Strategy Details from the Develop Strategy and Plan App in SAP Ariba Category Management

Our new Category Strategy Details tool in the Develop Strategy and Plan app empowers category managers to create and manage multiple category-specific strategy details aligned with the overall business strategy.

Category strategy details in SAP Ariba Category Management

Ability to View, Analyze, and Manage Initiatives Across Categories in SAP Ariba Category Management

Manage your initiatives through the new Initiatives Overview app, providing comprehensive tools for tracking, optimizing, and visualizing data.

Initiatives overview in SAP Ariba Category Management

 

Create Optimization Scenarios for Multi-Round Bidding Events in Guided Sourcing

Generate optimization scenarios for multi-round bidding events, including editing constraints and updating scenarios with the latest data.

Enhancements to Grading and Scoring in Guided Sourcing

Improved grading features for guided sourcing, including offline grading for primary bids and rolled-up section level grading for alternate bids.

See the SAP Ariba Source to Contract 2411 Release Key Innovations Preview blog for more information on these and other source to contract features

SAP Ariba Procure to Order

Support for PunchOut Items in SAP Ariba Shopping Mobile App

You can now purchase items from external supplier catalogs through Level 1 PunchOut catalogs directly from the SAP Ariba Shopping mobile app. This enhancement broadens your product range for mobile shopping while ensuring compliance and approvals are managed through the normal Ariba checkout process.

View and Edit Requisition Line Items in SAP Ariba Shopping Mobile App

The SAP Ariba Shopping mobile app now provides detailed line item information in the requisition details screen and allows users to edit line items directly from the checkout screen. This update enhances flexibility and transparency in the mobile requisitioning process.

See the SAP Ariba Procure to Order 2411 Release Key Innovations blog for more information on these and other features

For further reading and resources, check out the links below and dive deeper into each specific innovation.

Resources:
    • Register for the Early Release Series for 2411 release
    • Resources:
      • Feature related materials
        • SAP Ariba Connect - Release Readiness (Customers except CIM)
        • Readiness Community page (For CIM customers)
      • SAP Community for Intelligent Spend Management page
      • SAP Help Portal pages - Procurement and Network 
      • What’s New
    • Check out our content on youtube!
      • SAP Products and Services YouTube channel - https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLWV533hWWvDk7zRbhOsWQkF5BGWokhHYH
      • "Spend Management and Business Network" playlist - https://youtube.com/playlist?list=PLWV533hWWvDk7zRbhOsWQkF5BGWokhHYH&si=zTlYobcledkWNQ2M

entry.title: Where can I start learning principles and strategies of SAP Ariba Category Management?
entry.content:
I recommend to access our Introducing SAP Ariba Category Management Fundamentals learning journey.

Overview
This course will teach the learner how to create, manage, and monitor category-specific strategies to achieve their organization’s procurement goals.

Learning objectives
Upon the completion of this learning journey, participants will gain insight into how a Category Manager creates a category profile by classifying a product category, uploading company policies, laws, and regulations concerning that specific category, and adding team members and stakeholders that will assist with the execution of the strategy. Then, develop a strategy and plan, including category and market analysis, strategy and implementation, and approval. Finally, monitor the strategy execution to see if goals are met, initiatives are on target, and upcoming events are posted in the planning calendar. 

Prerequisites

  • Learning Journey: Discovering Category Management

Pass all the quizzes and receive a digital badge

Please ask a question related to the digital learning Journey in the Q&A area. 

Our SAP Learning Experts will get back to you as soon as possible! We are here to support you. 

I appreciate your feedback and we will make sure to continue sharing interesting topics.

Kind regards
Margit

entry.title: Are you looking for SAP Ariba Contracts learning materials for beginners?
entry.content:
I recommend to access our Implementing SAP Entitlement Management learning journey.

Overview
This beginner learning journey will introduce you to the key features and functions for contract workspace creation and amending. Through self-paced content, system simulations, and videos you will learn how to handle the creation, publishing and amending steps in the contract lifecycle.

Learning objectives
After completing this learning journey, business users, consultants, and administrators will be able to create, publish and modify contract workspaces using the SAP Ariba Contracts application.

Prerequisites

  • Discovering SAP Ariba Contracts

Pass all the quizzes and receive a digital badge

Please ask a question related to the digital learning Journey in the Q&A area. 

Our SAP Learning Experts will get back to you as soon as possible! We are here to support you. 

I appreciate your feedback and we will make sure to continue sharing interesting topics.

Kind regards
Margit

entry.title: 2502 Early Release Series for SAP Ariba and SAP Business Network releases
entry.content:
Sign up now for the 2502 Early Release Series

Follow this blog to receive notification of new series as soon as registration opens.

SAP strives to equip our customers and partners with valuable release readiness resources for each SAP Ariba and SAP Business Network quarterly release.

Early Release Series

The SAP Ariba and SAP Business Network Early Release series of webcasts cover features planned for the upcoming quarterly release.  This platform, available to customers and partners, has a clear mission: deliver an interactive forum to engage with SAP product experts providing simple, direct answers to your most pressing questions.  There is a different session for each product area with content tailored for the specific audience:

  • Business Network
  • Supplier Management & Risk and Procure to Pay
  • Source to Contract

If you want to learn more and actively engage with SAP subject matter experts, we encourage you to participate in these informative sessions.  Register now!

Quarterly Release Communications

Notice of upcoming quarterly releases will be communicated to Buyer customers three weeks prior to the release date.  Suppliers receive notice two weeks prior.  Releases are communicated via email notification (look for subject line starting with: Advance Release Notice).

Anyone from your organization that has chosen to subscribe to product notifications will receive these announcements. 

The release calendar for SAP Business Network and release calendar SAP Ariba Applications identify release timing several quarters in advance.

 Where to find out more details?

On demand replays of webcasts from completed quarterly releases can be consumed from Release Readiness Resources: Webcast Archive Page

entry.title: SAP Ariba Source to Contract 2502 Release Key Innovations Preview
entry.content:
Hello SAP Ariba Source to Contract Community and welcome to our 2502 key innovations blog.

We're thrilled to unveil the latest features in our Q1 2025 release for SAP Ariba's source-to-contract solutions. These innovations are designed to help you maximize business value, improve supplier relationships, and streamline your procurement processes. Let's dive right in.

SAP Spend Control Tower

Travel & Expense dashboard, presenting information from Concur (ARBTS-56)

With the new Travel & Expense Dashboard, synchronization with SAP Concur is seamless, delivering detailed insights into your travel and expense spend category. This feature covers expense types, payment modes, payment status, and spend categories through a user-friendly interface, pushing the boundaries of analysis efficiency. Understanding your organization's travel and expense spends is now more straightforward, enabling you to make informed decisions quickly.

Support for multiple currencies (ARBTS-629)

As we appreciate that global organizations grapple with managing invoices across a myriad of currencies, we've enhanced SAP Spend Control Tower to support conversion into multiple reporting currencies. Users can now configure their profiles to set the preferred reporting currency for dashboard data – aligning with your financial management strategies and facilitating accurate reporting. This feature provides transparency on global spend, aiding in discovering untapped value potential.

 

SAP Ariba Category Management

AI-assisted Category Strategy Recommendations (CATMAN-467)

SAP Ariba Category Management collects, digitizes and standardizes relevant information from various knowledge bases using AI to provide initial category strategy recommendations.

This new GenAI-powered solution empowers you to save significant time by automating the analysis of category and market dynamics, and leveraging best practices to develop an intelligently structured category strategy that meets stakeholders’ goals and requirements.

 

Supplier Preferencing Matrix (ARBCAT-726)

We're introducing a powerful tool for category managers—the Supplier Preferencing Matrix. This two-dimensional matrix allows you to evaluate how valuable your business is to your suppliers. By plotting the attractiveness of the buyer on one axis and the relative value of the account on the other, you can categorize suppliers and enhance relationships, improve engagement, and manage interactions more effectively.

Operational Reporting APIs for SAP Ariba Category Management (ARBCAT-713)

Great news for those who love data-driven decision-making. Our new Operational Reporting API, built on OpenAPI specifications and leveraging the OData standard, enables you to retrieve operational data from SAP Ariba Category Management. Now, you can access strategy and plan documents, categories with product classifications, and category profiles using external reporting tools. Comprehensive data analysis is just a click away.

The SAP Ariba Category Management APIs are published on the SAP Business Accelerator Hub.

 

SAP Ariba Guided Sourcing

Support for Large-Capacity Events in Guided Sourcing (SS-58288)

We've enhanced Guided Sourcing to support large-capacity RFP events. You can now manage non-competitive RFPs with up to 10,000 line items, 700 suppliers, and 50 terms per line item using Excel spreadsheets.

Line Item Details in Approval Tasks (SS-62650)

Attention to detail matters. That's why we've added the ability to include line item details in approval tasks sent from SAP Ariba Sourcing to the SAP Task Center. Keep everyone in the loop with clear, concise information that drives better decision-making.

 

SAP Ariba Contract Management

Effortless Line Item Management in Large-Capacity CLID (SC-22523)

Managing large-capacity Contract Line Items Documents (CLID) just got easier. With our new Simplified Excel Import functionality, buyers can import and export line item data, including service line items and pricing conditions, using a preformatted Excel file.

Custom Category Data for Supplier Risk Exposure (SC-22524)

SAP Ariba Contracts now integrates with SAP Ariba Supplier Risk and SAP Ariba Supplier Lifecycle and Performance solutions to provide custom category views of supplier risk exposure data. Combine company data, external data from third-party providers, and more to create up to 25 active custom risk categories per site. This feature ensures that risk management is tailored to your unique business needs.

 

Once, these items are officially released on February 14th, the feature reference IDs (i.e. SC-22524) can help to find more detailed information on http://help.sap.com.

We are continually working to enhance SAP Ariba solutions to ensure you achieve the best results for your business. We hope these new features and enhancements help you streamline your procurement processes, making them more efficient and effective. Stay tuned for more updates and happy sourcing.

We invite you to explore these features in more detail in our SAP Ariba 2502 Release Key Innovations Preview session. Also, stay tuned for our additional upcoming blog posts and follow me to stay informed on upcoming feature releases across SAP Ariba.

Thank you for being a part of the SAP Ariba community and we look forward to continuing our journey of innovation together!

Resources:

  • Feature related materials
    • SAP Ariba Connect - Release Readiness (Customers except CIM)
    • Readiness Community page (For CIM customers)
  • SAP Community for Intelligent Spend Management page
  • SAP Help Portal pages - Procurement and Network
  • What’s New

 

  • Want to see more? Take a look at
    • SAP Products and Services YouTube channel - https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLWV533hWWvDk7zRbhOsWQkF5BGWokhHYH
    • "Spend Management and Business Network" playlist - https://youtube.com/playlist?list=PLWV533hWWvDk7zRbhOsWQkF5BGWokhHYH&si=zTlYobcledkWNQ2M

entry.title: SAP Ariba 2502 Release Key Innovations Preview
entry.content:
Hello SAP Ariba Community! We are thrilled to present the latest features and enhancements from our 2502 release, focused on streamlining procurement processes, enhancing configuration flexibility, and boosting compliance. Let's delve deeper into the key innovations transforming your procurement and sourcing landscape:

Intelligent Configuration Manager Enhancements

Feature Toggle Management (PLICM-4237) Administrators now have the autonomy to manage select feature toggles directly, streamlining the process without needing to rely on SAP. This allows for a more agile testing and deployment cycle, promoting smoother transitions from test to production environments.

Feature Toggle Management

Please note this blog has been edited to remove reference to Configuration Bundles Creation (PLICM-4464) and Site Configuration Migration (PLICM-4465) as these features have been pushed to a future release.

Highlights from Procure-to-Order

Revamped Item Details Page (GB-24673) The item details page has been redesigned for a superior user experience, featuring advanced pricing information, multiple item images, and expanded supplier insights. A new section now gives insights into supplier diversity and risk attributes, aligning with your sustainability goals.

Revamped Item Details Page

 Spend Consumption Reports (CP-29451)  Access to Spend Consumption reports provides comprehensive tracking of PO and Non-PO spends, allowing organizations to enhance compliance and optimize spend management. These reports can be customized to fit billing cycles, offering flexibility and deeper insights.

Price Validation on Import (CP-29879) Ensure accuracy with automated price validation checks for requisition imports. The feature streamlines processing by flagging price discrepancies immediately, promoting efficient requisition handling and compliance with budget standards.

For further details on these innovations, take a look at our SAP Ariba Procure to Order 2502 Release Key Innovations

Highlights from Source to Contract

Travel & Expense dashboard, presenting information from Concur (ARBTS-56) The newly introduced Travel & Expense Dashboard integrates seamlessly with SAP Concur, offering detailed insights and reporting on expense types and payment status across multiple currencies. This allows for informed decision-making and spend optimization in global contexts.

Travel and Expense Dashboard

 

 


AI-Assisted Category Strategy (CATMAN-467) Leverage AI to generate strategic category recommendations, efficiently digitizing and analyzing category data and market dynamics. This supports effective strategy formulation and alignment with business objectives.

AI-Assisted Category Strategy

 

 

Supplier Preferencing Matrix (ARBCAT-726) A strategic tool for evaluating supplier relationships based on business value, aiding in better engagement, negotiation, and partnership opportunities, which ultimately bolsters procurement performance.

Supplier Preferencing Matrix

 

 

Operational Reporting APIs for SAP Ariba Category Management (CATMAN-468) Harness the power of APIs to access operational data from SAP Ariba Category Management, supporting robust data analysis through third-party tools to drive informed decision-making.

Support for Large-Capacity Events in Guided Sourcing (SS-58288) large-capacity RFP events allows you to manage complex sourcing workflows involving thousands of line items and hundreds of suppliers, thereby improving the scalability and reach of your sourcing initiatives.

For further details on these innovations and more, take a look at our SAP Ariba Source to Contract 2502 Release Key Innovations

Highlights from Central Invoice Management

Automatic Reprocessing of Invoices (CIM-657) Automate invoice reprocessing for missing receipts, providing better visibility and reducing the necessity for manual interventions, thus increasing efficiency.

Automatic Reprocessing of Invoices with Missing Receipts

 

Data Center US10 Deployment (CIM-1918) Establish a hosting presence in the United States for a broader range of options in managing access to SAP Ariba Central Invoice Management, offering flexibility aligned with business needs.

Peppol Network Integration (CIM-1159, CIM-212 - CIM-1150) Enable invoice receipt through the Peppol network for several countries, including New Zealand, Australia, Finland, Belgium, and Luxembourg, enhancing international invoicing capabilities.

XML File Processing with API (CIM-1816)  Support XML files in Supplier Invoices and Document Extraction API, improving data extraction from invoices for streamlined processing and increased accuracy, including support for electronic invoices like Germany's XRechnung.

 

Enhanced Approval Workflow Conditions (CIM-1585) Introduce new conditions for approval workflows, adding flexibility in handling invoices based on Purchase Orders and other criteria to align closely with business processes.

Parallel Workflow Support (CIM-1711) Support parallel workflows for supplier invoices, enabling simultaneous approval and information requests, which enhances workflow efficiency and reliability.

Document Information Extraction Templates (CIM-1942) Utilize templates to improve data field extraction from invoices, ensuring enhanced accuracy and reducing manual entry errors.

Use Document Information Extraction Templates

 

New India Data Center Support (CES-1088)

Localized Connectivity: New SAP Ariba customers in India can connect to the latest India data center, offering improved performance and optimized data localization for enhanced regulatory compliance. Note that existing customers cannot migrate their data to the new data center.

These innovations aim to significantly enhance your procurement and sourcing capabilities, leading to improved efficiency, data-driven insights, and strengthened supplier relationships.

Stay connected with our community for more insights and updates:

Register for the Early Release Series for 2502 release

  • Resources:
    • Feature related materials
      • SAP Ariba Connect - Release Readiness (Customers except CIM)
      • Readiness Community page (For CIM customers)
    • SAP Community for Intelligent Spend Management page
    • SAP Help Portal pages - Procurement and Network
    • What’s New
    • SAP Products and Services YouTube channel - https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLWV533hWWvDk7zRbhOsWQkF5BGWokhHYH
    • "Spend Management and Business Network" playlist - https://youtube.com/playlist?list=PLWV533hWWvDk7zRbhOsWQkF5BGWokhHYH&si=zTlYobcledkWNQ

Make sure to check out our other blogs and subscribe to all of our authors to keep up to date with the latest and greatest innovations!

entry.title: Streamlining PDF Transfers to Ariba with SAP CPI: Solving Multipart Form-Data Formatting Challenges
entry.content:
In this blog post, we explore the challenge of sending a PDF file in binary format to the Ariba 'create-project-document' API or any other third party system using SAP Cloud Platform Integration (CPI). A common issue arises when using the Content Modifier to handle data in multipart form-data format, as this can disturb the PDF format.

To address this, implementing a Groovy script provides an effective solution. This script constructs the multipart form-data payload correctly for file transmission without altering the PDF's integrity.

 

The Challenge:

When attempting to send a PDF file using the Content Modifier in multipart form-data format, users often find that the PDF format gets distorted, resulting in unsuccessful data transmission. The Content Modifier, while useful for many tasks, can inadvertently alter binary data, leading to corrupted files.

The Solution:

Using a Groovy script within SAP CPI, we can properly format the PDF data as multipart form-data. Here's a Groovy script example that can be used to achieve this:

import com.sap.gateway.ip.core.customdev.util.Message;

import java.util.HashMap;

def Message processData(Message message) {

def pdfContent = message.getProperty("pdfFileContent") as byte[];

def boundary = "----WebKitFormBoundary7MA4YWxkTrZu0gW";

 

def payload = new StringBuilder();

payload.append("--").append(boundary).append(" ");

payload.append("Content-Disposition: form-data; name="file"; filename="document.pdf" ");

payload.append("Content-Type: application/pdf ");

payload.append(new String(pdfContent, StandardCharsets.ISO_8859_1)).append(" ");

payload.append("--").append(boundary).append("--");

 

message.setHeader("Content-Type", "multipart/form-data; boundary=" + boundary);

message.setBody(payload.toString().getBytes(StandardCharsets.ISO_8859_1));

return message;

}

 

Additional Tip:

When adding the PDF binary data to a property using a Content Modifier, it’s essential not to set any data type. Instead, start by adding this Groovy script to convert the InputStream to a byte array:

 

import com.sap.gateway.ip.core.customdev.util.Message;

import java.util.HashMap;

def Message processData(Message message) {

def body = message.getBody(java.io.InputStream);

 

// Convert InputStream to byte array

byte[] byteArray = body.bytes;

 

// Set the byte array as the new message body

message.setBody(byteArray);

 

return message;

}

Thank you for reading this blog! If you have any questions or need further assistance, please feel free to ask in the comments section below.

This blog post should help other SAP CPI users understand the issue with multipart form-data and how to resolve it using Groovy scripts.

entry.title: SAP Ariba Source to Contract 2505 Release Highlights
entry.content:
SAP Ariba Guided Sourcing

Guided Sourcing Integration with SAP WalkMe   [SOURCE-2530]

We’re excited to bring SAP WalkMe Digital Adoption Platform to Guided Sourcing. This integration provides step-by-step tours and tooltips directly in the UI to help users complete tasks confidently and quickly.

Need help setting up a sourcing event or adding a new contact? Just launch a WalkMe tour and get guided support through each step - available in all SAP Ariba-supported languages and major browsers.  It helps users ramp up faster, reduces support queries, and ensures consistency in how sourcing events are set up and managed.

 Bonus-Penalty in Guided Sourcing [SOURCE-1253]

Sourcing large-scale events often comes with a high volume of bids and variables. Our new Bonus-Penalty feature helps buyers and evaluators make more objective, transparent decisions.

You can now assign bonus or penalty values to supplier bids during the grading and scoring process. This lets you incorporate qualitative considerations—like sustainability practices or delivery timelines—directly into your bid evaluations. It brings clarity and fairness to supplier selection in complex events, helping teams align supplier choices with business goals.

View Period Quantity Assignments of Line Items on a Graph in Guided Sourcing [PSOURCE-1370]

Planning and analyzing time-based sourcing events just got easier. With this enhancement, buyers can now visualize quantity values per validity period using a bar chart, directly in the Guided Sourcing interface.

Clicking on a line item’s quantity value opens a graphical breakdown—no more guessing or toggling between spreadsheets. Plus, when the “Enable period quantity” condition is active, the total is now read-only, ensuring data consistency. This provides a quick and intuitive way to understand how quantities are distributed across time periods—perfect for more accurate planning and decision-making.

SAP Ariba Contracts

SAP Task Center Integration with SAP Ariba Contracts [SCONTR-1210]

Navigating approvals doesn’t need to be a labyrinth. With our new SAP Task Center integration, buyers can now process approval tasks directly assigned to them from SAP Ariba Contracts. This feature bridges the gap between task creation and completion, offering a clear and direct path for approvals. By centralizing these tasks, users can expect faster turnaround times and reduced administrative overhead.

The SAP Task Center service enables integration with SAP and non-SAP applications to provide a single entry point for end users to access all their assigned tasks. You can use SAP Task Center as a unified inbox for tasks across multiple applications with integrated user experience. Tasks from multiple SAP solutions are gathered in one list and ready to be processed in just one click, shortening the completion time for business-critical tasks. For example, business users can process all their tasks from the connected systems, without the need to switch and log in separately into different inboxes.

Customize Your Contract ID Prefix [SCONTR-1280]

Understanding that every business has unique identifiers, we’re adding flexibility to contract management with the ability to customize the prefix for the Contract ID in SAP Ariba Contracts.  A well-structured contract ID can help to improve contract management by making it easier to identify, locate, and manage contracts. 

Choose a prefix that aligns with your business needs and makes tracking contracts more intuitive for your team. This customization allows for a personal approach to contract management and user-friendly tracking.

User Interface Enhancements for Non-Disclosure Agreement Contracts [SCONTR-1395]

Navigating non-disclosure agreements (NDAs) just got easier. Our enhanced user interface for managing NDA contracts introduces several changes that enhance visibility and accessibility. This ensures clarity and ease-of-use, making the management of sensitive agreements less cumbersome. Whether you're creating, tracking, or archiving NDAs, our streamlined interface is designed to simplify each step, allowing users to focus on what matters most—business confidentiality and compliance.  Changes to the User Interface include:

  • The filter bar, previously located at the top of the Manage NDA Templates and the Manage NDAs pages, is now placed inside the data table on each respective page.
  • The icon for sorting data with each column is changed.
  • There are font style changes on the Manage NDA Templates and the Manage NDAs pages to emphasize titles, default input text fields, data entries in tables, and more.

For highlights in Category Management in this release, please use the link below:

SAP Ariba Category Management 2505 Release Highlights - SAP Community

entry.title: How to Streamline SAP Ariba Contract Workspaces with Bots Without Overloading Your System
entry.content:
A common challenge when using bots in SAP Ariba is ensuring that they are properly customised to prevent system performance issues. One scenario where this is especially important is when bots imitates human actions, ensuring consistency and efficiency responsible for updating mass contract workspaces, which can result in the creation of over 10,000 purchase requisitions (PRs). in such cases the bots must be carefully optimised to avoid overwhelming the system.

Here’s an example of the process when a bot updates a contract workspace and generates PRs:

  1. Navigating to the Contract Workspace

The bot begins by accessing the contract workspace and selecting the contract terms. This is similar to a manual process where a human would navigate through the interface. The bot then opens the contract terms and selects the appropriate realm, along with a few necessary details, ensuring the correct data is populated for further processing

       2. Creating Contract Terms

Next, the bot clicks the "Create" button to initiate the creation of the contract terms. During this step, it auto-populates the header information, such as the requester and requestor’s details (when creating auto-release PRs). Any required details are defined, including potential issues that might arise, such as missing or incorrect purchasing units or data selection, which have occasionally led to errors in past processes.

      3. Completing Contract Limits and Pricing Terms

The bot proceeds to the “Limits” tab and fills in any relevant limits that are required, though this step generally involves fewer entries. Once completed, it moves on to the line items, where the bot will input all the pricing terms. Unlike previous methods that may have relied on Excel files, the bot now completes this step by going line by line—filling in details such as descriptions, community codes, and material groups for each line item. Once this is done, it will save the information and return to the contract workspace.

       4. Attaching Files and Publishing the Contract

If required, the bot will attach any reference files associated with the contract. After completing all necessary updates and reviewing the terms, the bot publishes the contract workspace. This creates the contract term and prepares it for the final steps.

       5.Automating PR Creation

Once the contract terms and workspace are finalized, the bot auto-releases the requisitions (PRs). This automation eliminates the need for manual intervention, ensuring that PRs are created and released in accordance with the contract’s details.

       6. Contract Amendments and Updates

The process for contract amendments follows a similar structure, with the primary difference being that a contract workspace already exists. In this case, the bot updates the contract terms based on the provided information. These updates can include modifications to the header information, line items, or even the closure of the contract. Once the updates are completed, the bot saves and submits the changes, and then publishes the updated contract term, ensuring that PRs continue to be auto-released.

 

Example of the process

During the contract workspace creation or update process in SAP Ariba, there are eight distinct SourcingUpdateRequest messages that are exchanged between the Buyer application and the Sourcing application. These messages follow this sequence:

  1. Composing
  2. Submitted
  3. Sourced
  4. SourcingConfirming
  5. SourcingConfirming - Action - Approved
  6. SourcingCompleted
  7. Processing
  8. Processed

Each of these steps involves the system processing a message, and the system requires approximately 2 seconds to process each message. Therefore, for a single contract, it will take around 16 seconds (2 seconds × 8 messages) for the entire message exchange process to complete.

Managing Large-Scale Contract Workspace Updates

When dealing with large numbers of contract workspaces (e.g., updating or creating over 1,000 contract workspaces via bots), careful attention must be paid to system load and message queue management to avoid performance issues. To ensure smooth processing, the following guidelines are recommended:

  1. Batch Processing with Pauses:
    • It is advisable to process contracts in batches of 1,000 contracts at a time. After each batch, introduce a 30-minute pause before starting the next batch. This pause allows the message queue to be cleared and drained from the previous batch of contracts, ensuring that new messages don’t overload the system and cause delays.
  2. Pause Between Contract Request Creation and Publish:
    • To further optimize the process, it is recommended to introduce a 15-second pause between contract request creation and publishing. This is especially important when multiple bots are being used. For example, if 15 bots are running in parallel, each bot sends its own "Composing" message into the queue. By introducing the 15-second pause, the system ensures that these parallel messages have time to propagate, and the "Publish" button becomes visible for the next steps in the process.

Also additionaly to reduce the load to the system there is a parameter and feature toggle that can to Optimize sending sourcing update messages to SAP Ariba Contracts

Compliance Contracts with SAP Ariba Contracts

Restrain sending sourcing update messages

However, it is important to note,  if your business is already using or planning to implement bots within SAP Ariba, it is essential to follow SAP’s guidelines to ensure compliance and system stability. According to SAP Knowledge Base Article KB0405392, customers are contractually prohibited from using non-human users (bots) in SAP Ariba systems without proper registration. Although SAP Ariba does not officially support or certify bots, it does allow their use—provided they are registered through the SAP Ariba Developer Portal. Registration helps SAP recognise bot usage, ensures contractual compliance, and promotes responsible and secure implementation.

For further details and specific restrictions, refer to:

OPEC-6466: Support of RPA Bots on the Developer Portal

KB0405179: How to register iRPA Bots in SAP Ariba Developer Portal

By following these best practices, businesses can ensure that the bots function efficiently while maintaining optimal system performance, even when processing large volumes of contract workspaces.

entry.title: Explore Contract Management: Master Assembled Docs, Clause Library, Templates and More!
entry.content:
I recommend to access our Managing SAP Ariba Contracts learning journey.

Overview
This intermediate learning journey will introduce you to the management of contract workspace functionality, such as assembled documents, clause library, templates, and legacy contracts.

Learning objectives

  • Author assembled documents in contract workspaces.
  • Create clauses for the Clause Library
  • Load legacy contracts
  • Manage digital signatures
  • Administer contract workspace templates

Prerequisites

  • Discovering SAP Ariba Contracts
  • Introducing SAP Ariba Contracts

Please post you question related to the digital learning Journey in the Q&A area. 
Our SAP Learning Experts will get back to you as soon as possible! We are here to support you. 

I appreciate your feedback and we will make sure to continue sharing interesting topics.

Kind regards,
Susann
